basics.name: Sweta Pati
basics.label: Master's Student in Computer Science
basics.summary: A dedicated Master's student in Computer Science specializing in Machine Learning with extensive research and professional experience in data science, NLP, and machine learning.

work.name: George Mason University
work.summary: Researching NLP topics such as Event Extraction and Prompt Engineering under the guidance of Prof. Ziyu Yao.

work.name: Highradius Technologies Private Limited
work.summary: Implemented and deployed machine learning models for Fortune 500 companies, enhancing operational efficiency and predictive accuracy.
highlights: Developed Deduction Validity Predictor (DVP) with 85% accuracy, increasing recovery rates by 12%.
Implemented Payment Date Prediction (PDP), reducing Days Sales Outstanding (DSO) by 30%.
Automated ML pipelines reducing implementation timelines for DVP by 48% and PDP by 57%.
Mentored over 15 interns in data science and business concepts.

work.name: Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur
work.summary: Developed BCH error correction codes and tested OpenSSL authentication protocols.
highlights: Published a paper titled 'An OpenSSL Extension for PUF-based Authentication' in IEEE DSP 2018.

awards.title: Oracle Cloud Infrastructure 2024 Generative AI Certified Professional
awards.summary: Certification in Generative AI demonstrating expertise in Oracle's Cloud Infrastructure.

awards.title: Best Performer of the Team
awards.summary: Awarded for exceptional contributions across three quarters.

awards.title: Winner, Smart India Hackathon
awards.summary: Recognized for innovative problem-solving at the national level.

certificates.name: Oracle Cloud Infrastructure 2024 Generative AI Certified Professional

projects.name: Event Extraction
projects.summary: Enhancing event extraction with instruction-tuned LLMs to improve domain generalization.
highlights: Developed comprehensive guidelines for 13 datasets and improved F1-score by 8%.
Engineered preprocessing steps to optimize evaluation.

projects.name: Prompt Optimization
projects.summary: Explored zero-shot, few-shot, CoT, and optimization techniques for LLM prompts.
highlights: Delivered actionable and optimized inputs for improved LLM performance.
